title: AC Milan 'negotiations are continuing' for Everton star Gerard Deulofeu after mistakenly announcing loan deal

AC Milan are continuing talks with Everton for winger Gerard Deulofeu after mistakenly announcing the Spaniard's signing on Twitter. 
The Rossoneri tweeted that the 22-year-old had signed a loan agreement until the end of the season on Friday, but the Toffees complained, leading to the club removing the post. 
CEO Adriano Galliani was quizzed further on Saturday ahead of Milan's crunch match with Napoli but would not be drawn further. 
"I am authorised to say that the negotiations for Deulofeu are continuing," reiterated the Milan chief. "Are we feeling confident? The only thing I can say is that the negotiations continue." AC Milan posted the above image on Friday to confirm Deulofeu's signing before deleting it Read More Everton's Gerard Deulofeu at the centre of three-way transfer tussle with Goodison exit now likely 
Deulofeu has featured just 13 times this season, failing to score, and does not feature in Ronald Koeman's immediate plans.
